title: Add pass package to home-manager email configuration
notes: Prerequisites for password management setup. Add 'pass' to home.packages in home-manager/server/email/default.nix alongside lynx, chafa, and poppler_utils.

title: Configure aerc with unsafe-accounts-conf setting
notes: Required for passwordCommand to work with accounts.email module. Update programs.aerc.extraConfig to include: general = { unsafe-accounts-conf = true; }. Despite the ironic name, this is necessary and safe when using passwordCommand.

title: Set up accounts.email configuration for aerc
notes: Main declarative email account configuration. Create accounts.email.accounts structure with IMAP/SMTP settings (use placeholder values). Set up passwordCommand = "pass show email/personal". Enable aerc integration with aerc.enable = true. User will need to fill in actual email addresses, servers, and account details. Depends on nixos-1 and nixos-2 being completed first.

title: Document pass setup steps for email passwords
notes: Add comments/documentation to email/default.nix for manual setup steps. User needs to: 1) Generate GPG key: gpg --gen-key, 2) Initialize pass: pass init "your-gpg-id", 3) Store passwords: pass insert email/personal (or whatever path matches passwordCommand). Optionally document encrypting ~/.password-store with git-crypt for backup.

title: Clean up and remove plan.md
notes: Delete plan.md after implementation is complete. This temporary planning document is no longer needed once the aerc email configuration has been successfully implemented.

title: Enable format-flowed for plain text emails in aerc
notes: Add 'format-flowed = true' to the [compose] section in aerc extraConfig. This enables RFC 3676 format=flowed for outgoing plain text emails, which allows email clients like Gmail to properly reflow text that has hard line breaks from nvim. This fixes the issue where recipients see extra line breaks.

title: Add pandoc and typst packages for HTML email composition
notes: Add 'pandoc' and 'typst' packages to home.packages in email/default.nix. These are needed for converting Typst documents to HTML emails. Typst will be used to write formatted emails, and pandoc will convert them to HTML format for sending.

title: Set up Typst-to-HTML email workflow in aerc
notes: Create a workflow for composing HTML emails from Typst. This involves: 1) Creating a conversion script/filter that converts Typst -> HTML using pandoc, 2) Configuring aerc to use this workflow (possibly via a custom keybinding or editor command), 3) Documenting the workflow for user. The user should be able to write emails in Typst format and have them automatically converted to HTML before sending.

title: Configure custom orgmode agenda menu commands
description: Add org_agenda_custom_commands configuration to /etc/nixos/home-manager/server/neovim/lua/plugins/init.lua (after line 105). Define custom agenda views: 'a' for combined TODO|STRT|NEXT|IDEA view, 'c' for calendar week view, 't' for TODO-only, 's' for STRT-only, 'n' for NEXT-only, 'i' for IDEA-only. Uses tags_todo type with match syntax /KEYWORD for filtering.

title: Test custom orgmode agenda menu
description: After implementing NEXT keyword and custom agenda commands, verify: 1) Restart Neovim and test NEXT keyword shows in magenta/bold, 2) Press <leader>aa and verify all custom commands appear (a,c,t,s,n,i), 3) Create test items with different TODO keywords, 4) Test each agenda view filters correctly, 5) Verify 'a' shows combined TODO|STRT|NEXT|IDEA view

title: Add NEXT keyword to orgmode TODO states
description: Add 'NEXT' to org_todo_keywords list in /etc/nixos/home-manager/server/neovim/lua/plugins/init.lua (line 97). Place NEXT before the | separator to mark it as an active TODO state. Color configuration already exists at line 102.
